songs.full_title: Act My Age by Katy Perry
songs.title: Act My Age

description.plain:
‘Act my Age’ is the seventeenth and closing track of the deluxe edition of ‘Witness’



On the track, Katy is attacking ageism and talks about it from a female point of view, because when the woman ages, she is constantly told that she will lose her beauty, she will no longer be attractive, her sex life will die completely and many stupid restrictions. Also considering that Katy during her career has received criticism of being “a 30-year-old woman acting childlike and a 13-year-old girl,” this song may be a response to those criticisms.

songs.full_title: Agree To Disagree by Katy Perry
songs.title: Agree To Disagree

description.plain: “Agree to Disagree” is a song written by Katy Perry, Adrienne Follesé, Keith Follesé, and Nick Trevisick and was recorded for (A) Katy Perry. The song is registered on her ASCAP and BMI. The song can be heard on Nick Trevisick’s official website, along with “Wish You the Worst” and “I Can”.

songs.full_title: All You Need Is Love by Katy Perry
songs.title: All You Need Is Love

description.plain:
Katy sings a cover of The Beatles' 1967 song “All You Need Is Love” in the Gap 2021 Ad for their All Together Now end-of-year campaign, to raise money for charity.
Worth to mention that this song was released on her 37th birthday.

For every stream gained on Spotify, $1 will be donated to the charity Baby2Baby up to $100,000

songs.full_title: Bad Photographs by Katy Perry
songs.title: Bad Photographs

description.plain: “Bad Photographs” is a song written by Katy Perry for her fourth studio album, PRISM. Perry revealed the title of the song and a few lines from the lyrics in an interview for her first Vogue cover. The song was ultimately left unfinished and redone into “Miss You More” from the album Witness.

songs.full_title: Bigger Than Me by Katy Perry
songs.title: Bigger Than Me

description.plain:
“Bigger Than Me” is a self reflecting anthem about finding one’s purpose from Katy Perry’s album Witness, released on June 9th, 2017.

According to Billboard, the song is “a track inspired by Hillary Clinton’s loss in the 2016 presidential election”.

songs.full_title: Birthday by Katy Perry
songs.title: Birthday

description.plain:
“Birthday” is one long double entendre in which Katy compares birthdays to sex. It serves as the fourth single to Prism.

In the music video, Katy assumes five convincing personas and ruins other people’s parties, hidden-camera-style.

songs.full_title: Bon Appétit by Katy Perry (Ft. Migos)
songs.title: Bon Appétit

description.plain:
“Bon Appétit” is the second single off of Katy Perry’s fifth studio album, Witness. The song features the hip-hop group Migos. Perry teased the track in a pre-Grammy Interview with radio host Ryan Seacrest, stating that it’s “pretty sexual.”

On the summery dance-pop track, Perry boasts about her efforts to fulfill a lover’s sexual appetites. The track contains many food-related sexual innuendos. During her appearance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, Perry said the song represented “sexual liberation”.

Perry hinted the release of the song by emailing fans a recipe for the “World’s Best Cherry Pie”.



The song marks the first collaboration between Perry and the Atlanta trio.

songs.full_title: Boomerang by Katy Perry
songs.title: Boomerang

description.plain: “Boomerang” is a song written by Katy Perry and Jonatha Brooke‏ for her fourth studio album, PRISM. On Brooke’s official twitter he confirmed he wrote this song along with “Choose Your Battles”. Brooke tweeted about this song saying “"Boomerang” is an excellent ear treacle… but we never finished it… :(“. This song along with "Bad Photographs” are two known songs that were unfinished during the Prism writing sessions with the latter being be completed as “Miss You More” during the Witness sessions.

songs.full_title: Brick by Brick (MTV Unplugged) by Katy Perry
songs.title: Brick by Brick (MTV Unplugged)

description.plain:
“Brick By Brick” is a song written by Katy Perry and Greg Wells.

The song is part of the set list for the live album, MTV Unplugged.

During the song’s initial run, it was only performed live in places, such as: The Hotel Café, encore events at concerts, stripped performances etc.) but was later leaked on the internet.

The song is rumored to have been originally been written for Ashley Tisdale, but has been unconfirmed.

songs.full_title: California Dreams Tour Setlist by Katy Perry
songs.title: California Dreams Tour Setlist

description.plain:
The California Dreams Tour was the second concert tour by American singer Katy Perry, in support of her third studio album Teenage Dream. The tour played 127 shows beginning 20 February 2011 and concluding on 22 January 2012.

At the end of 2011, Billboard ranked it #13 on its annual “Top 25 Tours”, earning nearly $48.9 million.

songs.full_title: California Gurls by Katy Perry (Ft. Snoop Dogg)
songs.title: California Gurls

description.plain:
In 1965 The Beach Boys recorded the original “California Girls.” Their lyrics proclaimed that none of the other girls in the US could top California girls. In Perry’s number one hit “California Gurls” we hear how amazing West Coast girls are from one of them.

The song features Californian rapper and first time collaborator Snoop Dogg. He borrows a line directly from the Beach Boys when he says “I really wish you all could be California Girls.”

songs.full_title: California Gurls (Demo) by Katy Perry (Ft. Snoop Dogg)
songs.title: California Gurls (Demo)

description.plain: “California Gurls (Demo)” is the demo version of Katy Perry’s song “California Gurls”. The unmastered demo version leaked online days prior to the official version’s release, which was released May 7, 2011. The beats in the demo are a bit louder, and a few new adlibs are found in the outro.

songs.full_title: Chained to the Rhythm by Katy Perry (Ft. Skip Marley)
songs.title: Chained to the Rhythm
songs.title_with_featured: Chained to the Rhythm (Ft. Skip Marley)

description.plain:
“Chained To The Rhythm” continues Katy’s trend of releasing catchy lead singles, but also features more politically charged lyrics than her prior projects. Perry described the song itself as “purposeful pop” on her Twitter. The song features Skip Marley, the grandson of Bob Marley.

The release culminates a guerrilla marketing effort in which disco balls with headphone jacks were strategically placed in cities around the world. Fans who hunted them down got to listen to “Chained to the Rhythm” before its official debut, including us.

https://twitter.com/Genius/status/829366314309390336?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

The song was performed live for the first time at the 2017 Grammy Awards.

The official music video was released on February 21st, 2017. The video is directed by Mathew Cullen and shows Katy visiting a futuristic theme park called ‘Oblivia’.

songs.full_title: Champagne Problems by Katy Perry
songs.title: Champagne Problems

description.plain:
“Champagne Problems” is an upbeat dance song which talks about getting through the hardest time in her relationship with Orlando Bloom.

Katy told People magazine

It’s a never-ending evolution, so it’s not peachy-keen jelly bean all the time."

Katy is saying that, after going through some hard times with her partner, she is now in a stage of her relationship that the only problems they get are superficial.

songs.full_title: Cozy Little Christmas by Katy Perry
songs.title: Cozy Little Christmas

description.plain:
“Cozy Little Christmas” is Katy Perry’s second Christmas song after “Every Day is a Holiday”, which was released as promotion for H&M in 2015. Perry wrote the song about spending Christmas with her family in Copenhagen and the lyrics talk about not needing gifts as love is more important.

The song was released as an Amazon Music exclusive in 2018, with the song intended to be released to all platforms in the near future, which happened in 2019, when the song was released digitally.

songs.full_title: Cry About It Later by Katy Perry
songs.title: Cry About It Later

description.plain:
Cry About It Later is the 2nd track off of Katy Perry’s 5th studio album Smile. It is an upbeat song about fixing your broken heart by going to the club and finding someone new to help you forget your old love so you can Cry About It Later.

The song got a Video in the Smile Video Series on August 28th.

songs.full_title: Daisies by Katy Perry
songs.title: Daisies

description.plain:
Marking the start of a new era, “Daisies” is a self-empowerment anthem by American singer-songwriter Katy Perry. Shortly after the track’s release, Katy took to her social media platforms to share the inspiration behind the song:

I wrote this song a couple [of] months ago as a call to remain true to the course you’ve set for yourself, regardless of what others may think.

She then elaborated on how the song has “taken a new meaning [for her]” after parts of the world went into a lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Unlike her past lead singles which tend to be more upbeat and bubbly, “Daisies” features a mid-tempo production in its verses and a guitar in its chorus. This is also Katy’s first time working with The Monsters & Strangerz — an American production and songwriting team who has previously worked on hits like January 2018’s “The Middle.”

songs.full_title: Dark Horse by Katy Perry (Ft. Juicy J)
songs.title: Dark Horse

description.plain:
“Dark Horse” is a song by American singer Katy Perry, released as the official third single from her studio album, PRISM. The song was originally released first on September 17, 2013, as a promotional single from the album.

Commercially, the song became Perry’s overall ninth number one single on the Billboard Hot 100, and her second from PRISM, as “Roar” reached the top spot months prior.

description.plain:
Information about the original version with Juicy J can be seen here. Some radio stations play a version of the song without Juicy J’s rap. The song without the rap has also officially been featured in the video game Just Dance 2015.

The difference between this solo version, and the original version, is that Juicy J’s lyrics are replaced with an instrumental in the intro and the lyrics “make me your Aphrodite” and “make me your one and only” in the third verse.

songs.full_title: Déjà Vu by Katy Perry
songs.title: Déjà Vu

description.plain:
“Déjà Vu” is a French expression used to describe  current event that has already happened in the past, or an event which has a strangely familiar feeling; one is seeing it all again.

“Déjà Vu” is an electro R&B tinged track. Katy first teased it on March 14, 2017 by releasing a vocals-only clip on her Instagram story. On the track, Katy describes a stagnant relationship where their arguments and issues are the same as they were in the past. When Katy sees their relationship, all she sees is the past repeating itself. She echoes this sentiment on track “Pendulum” later on in the album.
